intro: Clidemia fuertesii, commonly known as the Puerto Rican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream banks. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Clidemia fuertesii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of tropical ecosystems.
